The weakest of angels, cassisians usually serve as lackey messengers for more powerful angels or as spiritual guides for mortals. Despite their limited intellect, cassisians have a knack for precise recollection, particularly with scripture. Most cassisians are formed from the souls of trustworthy mortals, but some arise from fragments of greater angels destroyed in service to the celestial realms. **[Recall Knowledge - Celestial](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=46)): DC 15 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 10 [Cassisian](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2814) **Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 14 1.1 **Perception** +6; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Diabolic](/Languages.aspx?ID=117), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Empyrean](/Languages.aspx?ID=115) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +6, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +6, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +6, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +6 **Str** -1 **Dex** +1 **Con** +2 **Int** -1 **Wis** +1 **Cha** +1 **Repository of Lore** While the cassisian isn't particularly intelligent, they have perfect memory and can remember everything they see or hear. This allows them to attempt [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) checks on any topic with a +10 modifier, provided (at the GM's discretion) they've encountered the topic in question before. The cassisian's limited intellect often prevents them from acting upon their knowledge, making them a better resource than agent in using information. --- **AC** 16 , +1 status vs. [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) creatures **Fort** +7 **Ref** +6 **Will** +4 +1 status to all saves vs. unholy creatures **HP** 20 **Resistances** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=555) 3, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 3 **Weaknesses** unholy 3 **Transfer Protection** ([holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517)) A creature can wear a willing cassisian as a helmet. While it does, the cassisian can't act, but the cassisian extends their +1 status bonus to AC and saves against [unholy](/Traits.aspx?ID=521) creatures to their wearer. At any time, the cassisian can detach themself from their wearer as a single action. --- **Speed** fly 40 feet **Melee** headbutt +6 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Holy](/Traits.aspx?ID=517), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 0 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 1d6–1 bludgeoning **Divine Innate Spells** DC 16 - **Cantrips (1st)** [Know the Way](/Spells.aspx?ID=1582), [Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171) - **1st** [Heal](/Spells.aspx?ID=148) - **4th** [Read Omens](/Spells.aspx?ID=247) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=55)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127)) A cassisian can take the appearance of a dove, a winged humanoid, a dog, or a fish. Normally, this doesn't change their Speed or the attack and damage bonuses for their Strikes, but it might change the damage type Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). Any further changes for specific forms are noted below.
  • **Dog** size Small scent (imprecise) 30 feet, Speed 40 feet; Skills Athletics +6; Melee jaws +7, Damage 1d6+2 piercing plus [Knockdown](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=46)
  • **Fish** swim Speed 30 feet
**Eye Beams** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27)) The cassisian releases beams of heat or cold from their eyes, dealing 2d6 cold or fire damage (DC 17 basic Reflex save) to all creatures in a 15-foot line. They can’t use Eye Beams again for 1d4 rounds.
